lead_paragraph: Congress’s reaction to the president’s last State of the Union address was a reflection of the partisanship that Mr. Obama had pledged to reverse — a failure he called one of the great regrets of his tenure.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

snippet: Congress’s reaction to the president’s last State of the Union address was a reflection of the partisanship that Mr. Obama had pledged to reverse — a failure he called one of the great regrets of his tenure.

headline.main: Obama Speech Points to Successes, as Would-Be Successors Look On
headline.print_headline: An Incumbent Points to Successes as Would-Be Successors Look On

abstract: Congress largely reacts to Pres Obama's final State of the Union address with same acrimonious  partisanship that he had hoped to overcome when taking office; Republicans, for the most part, remain silently in their seats, while Democrats are vocally supportive, standing at times to cheer.
